sentences: This issue (FCCC/SBSTA/2009/MISC.12) was first considered by the SBSTA plenary on 8 December.
The Global Climate Observing System (GCOS) reported on its updated Implementation Plan, noting that the additional annual cost of a fully effective GCOS will be US$2.1 billion.

Many developing countries supported a greater focus on the needs of developing countries in terms of observing systems, and Burundi, Kuwait and Saudi Arabia highlighted the importance of early warning systems.
Chair Plume prepared procedural draft conclusions with assistance from the Secretariat and in consultation with interested parties.
The SBSTA adopted conclusions on 12 December.
